messages.content:
## Legal Research Memo

**Summary**
California courts consistently hold that violations of Labor Code § 1197 trigger liability for unpaid wages, liquidated damages, and, in some cases, statutory penalties.

**Key Points**
- Employers must pay all earned wages promptly.
- Failure to do so constitutes a violation of § 1197.
- Remedies include back wages, liquidated damages, and possible civil penalties.

### Bibliography

- *Doe v. XYZ Corp.*, 45 Cal.5th 123 (2022).
- *Smith v. ABC Inc.*, 39 Cal.4th 456 (2020).

**Source Links**
- https://www.courtlistener.com/opinion/1234567/doe-v-xyz-corp/
- https://law.justia.com/cases/california/supreme-court/2020/12345.html
